title: Check if you need to pay tax for charging an employee’s electric car

body.content:
Find out whether you or your employee need to pay tax or National Insurance for charging an electric car.

You can also check if your employee is eligible for [tax relief](/tax-relief-for-employees).

If the car is a hybrid you'll need to use the [company car and fuel benefit calculator](http://cccfcalculator.hmrc.gov.uk/), and select fuel type 'A'.

Find out whether you or your employee need to pay tax or National Insurance for charging an electric car.

You can also check if your employee is eligible for tax relief.

If the car is a hybrid you’ll need to use the company car and fuel benefit calculator, and select fuel type ‘A’.

nodes.title: How is your employee paid back?
Does your employee use the car for business or personal journeys?

body.content:
Business journeys are either:

+ journeys that are part of your employee’s duties, for example a service engineer travelling to an appointment
+ journeys an employee has to make to get to a temporary workplace

Travelling between home and a permanent workplace counts as a personal journey.

Business journeys are either:

  • journeys that are part of your employee’s duties, for example a service engineer travelling to an appointment
  • journeys an employee has to make to get to a temporary workplace

Travelling between home and a permanent workplace counts as a personal journey.

nodes.title: Did you only pay your employee back for their business miles, or for personal journeys too?
You don't need to pay tax or National Insurance on the electricity used to charge the car

body.content:
Your employee can claim [Approved Mileage Allowance Payments (AMAPs)](/expenses-and-benefits-business-travel-mileage/rules-for-tax). 

They may also be eligible for [Mileage Allowance Relief (MAR)](/tax-relief-for-employees/business-mileage-fuel-costs).

*[AMAPs]: Approved Mileage Allowance Payments
*[MAR]: Mileage Allowance Relief

Your employee can claim Approved Mileage Allowance Payments (AMAPs).

They may also be eligible for Mileage Allowance Relief (MAR).

nodes.title: Your payment to your employee counts as earnings

body.content:
You must: 

- add it to your employee’s other earnings 
- deduct and pay PAYE tax and Class 1 National Insurance through payroll

*[PAYE]: Pay As You Earn

You must:

  • add it to your employee’s other earnings
  • deduct and pay PAYE tax and Class 1 National Insurance through payroll
